snippet: Some mayoral contenders said they would halt the city’s appeal after a court found constitutional violations in the stops, but details on how they would reshape the policy are scarce.
abstract: Stop-and-frisk issue re-emerges on New York City mayoral campaign trail after federal judge says city’s use of tactic had violates constitutional rights of black and Hispanic young men; four Democrats pledge to overhaul the stop-and-frisk tactic and end the city’s appeal of the decision if elected, while several Republicans, stand by practice and pledge to defend it.
lead_paragraph: Some mayoral contenders said they would halt the city’s appeal after a court found constitutional violations in the stops, but details on how they would reshape the policy are scarce.

headline.main: After Decision, Mayoral Candidates Offer Many Opinions but Few Concrete Plans
